title: Are soldiers afraid of dying during war? - Quora

response.answer_text: I guess so, but its not like a fear that consumes you. For the most part you just do your job and dont think about it all that often, unless of course the enemy is trying to actively kill you or just recently tried doing so. I wasnt really afraid of being killed myself, but I did worry about my friends getting killed almost everyday. Its not like that movie The Hurtlocker which btw was a terrible piece of shit; where they have that one guy who’s always whining and afraid like a little bitch. I can tell you a guy like that would not be popular with his platoon mates and would most likely be sent back to the FOB to work in the TOC, pick up trash, pull gate guard or some other such menial shit.

You bet they are. It’s the only thing that matters. 99% of your time in combat, you are dealing with your fear: fighting it, suppressing it, and figuring out ways not to panic. The rest is just a game. Shooting, marching, running, changing positions; it’s very much like in training. It’s easy and almost everyone can do it. The fear, however, is a totally different thing. Being able to cope with it is what makes a good soldier.

No , They are not afraid to die and the reason for the same is stated below · The safety, honour and welfare of your country comes first always and every time. · The honour, welfare and comfort of the men you command comes next. · Your own ease, comfort and safety comes last always and every time. The Ethos of Indian Army Death to Dishonour A close bond amongst soldiers forces them to choose death to dishonour. The concept of 'IZZAT' (HONOUR) in the clan / unit enables them to shun the fear of death; to be called a coward in the peer group is worse than death.Valour Fearlessness in combat and in the face of the enemy even when fighting against great odds or even when facing sure death.Fidelity, Honour and Courage He is a man on whose shoulders lies the honour and integrity of his nation. He knows that he is the last line of defence and he cannot fail the Nation.

Soldiers are human beings.Everybody is afraid of death .It is natural.Some can overcome that fear ,some cannot.The point is ,who is able to overcome that fear for a greater good , for saving thousands of innocent life, is a Soldier.That super strength comes from their heart , they feel that urge to protect someone at any cost and that's why they do not fear death.

Yes because that's what keeps you alive. If you're not afraid of dying you become careless and don't pay attention. Of course this doesn't mean they all panic and become useless. They learn to deal with it and use it to their advantage. That's where training and experience kicks in. I've been in the army, and while I've never been in or even near a combat situation, I've spoken to those who where there, so my answer is based on that.

Yes. Why wouldn't they be? In war, people die in the most horrible ways imaginable. But you've brothers to your left and right, and you put them above yourself, just as they are doing with you, and you push on in spite of that fear. It's where the word courage comes from. If you fear nothing, you're not brave, You're stupid.

Durn tootin' they are. We had a TV repairman come to the house in the 50's (remember those days?). When he got the set working, the channel was showing a b/w clip of the Normandy invasion. He said "I was there". I (being 9 years old) replied, "Wow you were brave!". He said, "I was a 17 year old kid and scared to death". We all fell over laughing.

I want to make this clear i am not nor have ever been a memeber of the military i am a civillian vut i will say this no amount of training or mental toughness can prepare you for death one false move and all that training all that sweat and hell those men endured to get to where they are today goes down the drain and all you get is a medal and a body bag and last goodbye from all your friends and family

Im not a soldier but It seems like an obvious answer. Most probably, although all are different. It depends how you determine fear. For me you can only be brave when you’re afraid so even the bravest of men and women are afraid they just know that is probably best not to publicise this fear for the sake of those around them even though they know everyone is probably deelign the same.

Afraid yes, a major point of their training is to allow them to perform while being afraid. Humans want to live not die and fear is our natural defence against death. They also fear failure, and letting brothers down. Can't be brave without being afraid
Yes major of the soldier are afraid they don't know when they will die but they know it's come
